3ec8ddf971317ecdfb8f12f7ff6f6bbd (22:48): when making a decal on a mesh, i.e. positioning a texture using an Empty, the texture appears on the front and back of the mesh. How do I remedy this?

1a08ff51394d76c56dc8962b859dcfa7 (22:57): I got my stuff aligned to Z=0 and I use a World-background (sky)... Why can I see the horizon? Can I alter the position? Or do I have to change the Z-Offset of all my objects?
79360336097d72c92cd984c4e989706b (23:03): rigid, http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Blender_3D:_Noob_to_Pro/Build_a_skybox < off hand dunno , but this wiki may just help you
1a08ff51394d76c56dc8962b859dcfa7 (23:04): neighborlee, i know that... but the skybox doesn't use the "World" material function...

1a08ff51394d76c56dc8962b859dcfa7 (23:05): but I just alter the HorRGB-Color in a way that there is no visible seam... So one doesn't see a line when the camera moves up because it's the "end-of-the-texture"
1a08ff51394d76c56dc8962b859dcfa7 (23:07): neighborlee, yeah... just move the horizon down a bit... :)
